alert.note: Alert for Niobrara County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 8:08PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Niobrara County through 845 PM MDT... At 807 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Redbird, or 25 miles north of Lusk, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Niobrara County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for east central Wyoming.
